In Verus, multi-reserve currencies are designed to enhance system liquidity and provide benefits to users in several ways. 

Firstly, when multiple users enter the pool simultaneously during a block, the system's overall liquidity appears to be amplified, resulting in more stable slippage rates from block to block. This is because all transactions in a block cancel each other out towards parity, leading to a lower ratio of effective aggregate transaction size to aggregate liquidity. Additionally, the presence of other users (converters) in the block enhances system liquidity, even if users only intend to use the multi-reserve currency as a point-to-point conversion and not as a destination in itself. This creates a self-reinforcing effect where liquidity begets liquidity, making the system increasingly robust and attractive to users.

They can be thought of as self-rebalancing portfolios with zero fees and dynamic rebalancing, which occurs over 1000 times per day.
